intro: Scleranthus dissitiflorus, commonly known as the scattered-flowered thornweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae, which includes many species with adaptations for dry environments. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling herb with hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Scleranthus dissitiflorus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in harsh, sunny conditions.
